Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text:
My fiance and I have a habit of going in every city we visit in the oldest Café. This is it. This is the oldest in Amsterdam.
Coffee tastes good, serving is quick. Would return.
Bonus: it looks nice with Christmas decorations.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Decent place to meet people off the train... service was pretty good, waiter owner guy seems like he's got attitude but I found him charming and attentive, not rude at all... drinks prices are a bit steep but it's right by Amsterdam Station so what do you expect? I sat there for 3 hours so it can't be that bad

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: I love this bar it's very relaxing to sit there having a beer and watching the world go by .. people too and fro .. and the staff are great

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Excellent service and excellent staff. Highly recommend from this Canadian. The Chicken with Peanut Sauce was delicious.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Oldest bar in town and still great! If I remember correctly the Dutch version of 'Who do you think you are' found out that the winner of the ESC from 1969 is related to that place at one time in history and her name is Lenny Kuhr with 'De Troubadour' .

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Very cozy sweet spot to eat or drink.  The double vodka was very generous and the food well presented!

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Really nice café,  great service!! If the sun is  shinning there is a nice terras.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Place is ancient. I love the rustic atmosphere of the place. The beer menu is weak but with the barman's attitude is worth everything. He is totally medieval and that attitude make the place deserve a 6 star...

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: The oldest pub in Amsterdam. Prefect place for a drink. They were extremely helpful when we asked for directions. If i could give a 6 i would.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: Nice corner cafe with terrace, opposite Amsterdam Central Station. Cold beers, liquors, coffee, typical Dutch snacks, and a never boring view of a especially bustling part of the old city, with countless cyclists, pedestrians, trams, taxis an buses passing by. :)

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: The coffee is disastrous and the waiter/owner is rude.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: After getting some beers I asked for two glasses of water: the bartender was shockingly fast to open two mini bottles of water (less than a glass) which were 2.75 each. Paid for that, but for sure I’ll avoid this greedy place in the future.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: We came here twice and it was warm and comfy. The staff were really pleasant on our first visit- so I was surprised to read some reviewers had a negative experience. Our second visit was a little busier so not the same level of interaction …

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: We hunted this place down as it didn't look how we thought it would...old. Upon entry we got a very friendly welcome, and served instant. I ordered a drink of ale served only half glass traditional I guess and the lady got a latte and biscuit. He give is a historic tour and told us the life of the pub. We felt comfortable .

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
Review Text: It's a typical old Dutch bar. Not cheap but the location is superb. If the staff have time they will share the history with you. If it's busy, you won't even get a smile! Tis wot it is.

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek

Name: Caf√© Karpershoek
